Package ohos.agp.window.dialog

Class BaseDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.window.dialog.BaseDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDialog
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommonDialog, DisplayDialog, PopupDialog

    public class BaseDialog
extends Object
implements IDialog
    Implements class of the IDialog

    This class implements basic function of the IDialog class. It is inherited by its child classes to implement a specific dialog box.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    IDialog

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  BaseDialog.DialogListener
      Represents the listener for events of a dialog box.
      static interface  BaseDialog.DisplayCallback
      Represents the callback that is invoked when a dialog box is displayed.
      static interface  BaseDialog.RemoveCallback
      Represents the callback that is invoked when a dialog box is removed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseDialog

        public BaseDialog​(Context context)
        Base class used to create a Dialog instance.

        When calling this method, you must obtain a valid Context object.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the context.

      • BaseDialog

        public BaseDialog​(Context context,
                  int flag)
        The constructor of BaseDialog for DisplayDialog.

        When calling this method, you must obtain a valid Context object.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the context.
        flag - Indicates the flag.
        Throws:
        WindowManager.PermissionException - Throws this exception if dialog context is invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show​()
        Shows the content of a dialog box.
        Specified by:
        show in interface IDialog
        Throws:
        WindowManager.PermissionException - Throws this exception if no dialog box is found.

      • hide

        public void hide​()
        Hides the content of a dialog box.

        A hidden dialog box is not destroyed.

        Specified by:
        hide in interface IDialog

      • destroy

        public void destroy​()
        Destroys an existing dialog box.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface IDialog

      • isShowing

        public boolean isShowing​()
        Checks if a Dialog instance is showing.

        The showing state of a dialog box remains unchanged even it is overlapped.

        Returns:
        Returns True if the Dialog instance is showing; returns False otherwise.

      • setTransparent

        public BaseDialog setTransparent​(boolean isEnable)
        Sets whether to enable transparent background for a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        isEnable - Indicates whether transparent background will be enabled. True indicates is enabled; False indicates disabled.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().

      • setCornerRadius

        public BaseDialog setCornerRadius​(float radius)
        Sets the radius of the round corners of a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        radius - Indicates the radius of the round corners of the dialog box.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().

      • setAutoClosable

        public BaseDialog setAutoClosable​(boolean closable)
        Sets whether to enable automatic close a dialog box.

        If automatic close is enabled, a dialog box automatically closes when touching or clicking a position outside the dialog box.

        Parameters:
        closable - Indicates whether to enable automatic close of the dialog box.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().

      • setDuration

        public BaseDialog setDuration​(int ms)
        Sets the duration for automatic close of a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        ms - Indicates the duration for automatic close of the Dialog instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().

      • setSize

        public BaseDialog setSize​(int width,
                          int height)
        Sets the size of a dialog box.

        The default size is used If the user leaves the size unspecified.

        Parameters:
        width - Indicates the expected width of the dialog box.
        height - Indicates the expected height of the dialog box.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().

      • setAlignment

        public BaseDialog setAlignment​(int alignment)
        Sets the alignment attribute of a Dialog instance.

        By default, a dialog box is displayed at the center.

        Parameters:
        alignment - Indicates the expected position to display the dialog box.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().
        Since:
        4

      • setOffset

        public BaseDialog setOffset​(int offsetX,
                            int offsetY)
        Sets the offset for a dialog box.

        The offset can be set after the alignment attribute is set.

        Parameters:
        offsetX - Indicates the X-axis offset of the dialog box.
        offsetY - Indicates the Y-axis offset of the dialog box.
        Returns:
        Returns the BaseDialog object for continuous operations, for example, obj.setAutoClosable(false).show().

      • setDialogListener

        public void setDialogListener​(BaseDialog.DialogListener listener)
        Sets the listener for events of a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener for events of the dialog box.

      • create

        protected void create​()
        Creates a Dialog instance.

        This method takes priority over the onShow() method.

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate​()
        Callback interfaced used when creating a Dialog instance.

        This method takes priority over the onShow() method.

      • onShow

        protected void onShow​()
        Callback interface used when showning a Dialog instance.

        This method takes priority over the onShowing() method.

      • onHide

        protected void onHide​()
        Callback interface used when hiding a Dialog instance.

        This callback is triggered only when the hide() method is invoked

      • onDestroy

        protected void onDestroy​()
        Callback interface used when enabling automatic close of a Dialog instance.

        This callback is triggered only when the destroy() method is invoked.

      • onShowing

        protected void onShowing​()
        Called when the pre-layout of a dialog box is complete and the content is being shown in the dialog box.

      • registerRemoveCallback

        public void registerRemoveCallback​(BaseDialog.RemoveCallback callback)
        Registers a callback that is invoked when a dialog box is removed.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to register.
        Since:
        4

      • remove

        public void remove​()
        Removes a dialog box.

        When a dialog box is removed via this method, RemoveCallback is invoked. This is how this method differs from destroy().

        Specified by:
        remove in interface IDialog
        Since:
        3

      • registerDisplayCallback

        public void registerDisplayCallback​(BaseDialog.DisplayCallback callback)
        Registers a callback that is invoked when a dialog box is displayed.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to register.
        Since:
        4

      • searchComponentViaId

        public Component searchComponentViaId​(int id)
        Searches for the component with a specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the ID of the component to search for.
        Returns:
        Returns the component if found; returns null if id is invalid, indicating that the component does not exist or no dialog box is available.
        Since:
        4

      • obtainComponentViaId

        public final Component obtainComponentViaId​(int id)
        Searches for the component with a specified ID.

        This method is the same as searchComponentViaId(int Id), except that an exception is thrown if the specified ID is invalid.

        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the ID of the component to search for.
        Returns:
        Returns the component with the specified ID.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if id is invalid.
        Since:
        4
